ygData.subject: Re: What gems combine with silver for magic jewelry
ygData.msgSnippet: What kind of skill level does one need to do these stones?  I m at about 20, trained as much as I could, and haven t really had the money to practice any more.
ygData.messageBody:
What kind of skill level does one need to do these stones? I'm at about
20, trained as much as I could, and haven't really had the money to
practice any more. Money's been a pretty consistent problem for me. I
think I may just be doing things wrong, but I'm saving every gemstone I
snag from those earth elementals to try to keep going.

Also, do the illusion spells always blink before they go down? Or will
they drop unexpectedly like invisibility(very annoying)?

Lotwilla, Enchantress of the Eldritch Collective

charles besenhoffer wrote:
>
> From: charles besenhoffer <cbesenhoffer@...>
>
> The following is what i have gatherd in my tavels :
>
> Emerald = fire protection
> jade= mana
> pearl= poison protection
> periodot= cold protection
> topaz= poison protection
>
> if anyone knows of any others please let us all know.
>
> also the strength of the item is related to the metal used (i.e. enchanted silver
> grants +4 normally except with regards to the mana ring then it gives a +5 for
> some reason)
>
> Experimentor :))
>
> Humble Keeper of the Elements Enchanter :))
>
